Method Detail

normalizeCompareResult

public static int normalizeCompareResult(int result)
Converts a result from Comparator.compare(Object, Object) to -1, 0, or +1.

Parameters:
result - raw result, e.g., -17, 0, +17, etc.
Returns:
normalized compare result: -1, 0, or +1

chain

public static <TValue> Comparator<TValue> chain(Collection<Comparator<TValue>> comparatorCollection)
Creates a new comparator from a collection of comparators which returns the first non-zero compare result. A short-circuit algorithm is used, thus not all comparators are guaranteed to run. For example, if the first result is non-zero, none of the remaining comparators are run. This is important if the comparators are stateful.

As a special case, if the input list has exactly one element, it is returned unchanged.

Type Parameters:
TValue - type of object compared by each comparator
Parameters:
comparatorCollection - collection of comparators to chain. Must not be null, empty, or contain null elements.
Returns:
new comparator chaining the input list of comparators
Throws:
NullPointerException - if comparatorCollection (or any element) is null
IllegalArgumentException - if number of elements in comparatorCollection is zero
See Also:
DirectoryListing.sort(Comparator)
